problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_assigned_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Access the item and its assigned box index and position
        item_w: int = items[i].width
        item_h: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        box_idx: int = assignments[i]

        # Ensure the item fits within the boundaries of the box
        assert pos_x + item_w <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos_y + item_h <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_items_fit_in_assigned_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap_between_items(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # No overlap condition: one of the following must hold:
                # - i is to the right of j: xi >= xj + wj
                # - i is to the left of j: xi + wi <= xj
                # - i is above j: yi >= yj + hj
                # - i is below j: yi + hi <= yj
                assert (positions[i].x >= positions[j].x + items[j].width) or \
                       (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y >= positions[j].y + items[j].height) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y)

ensure_no_overlap_between_items(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

def ensure_position_bounds(
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].x <= 100
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        assert positions[i].y <= 100

ensure_position_bounds(x_y_positions)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 52, "height": 98}, {"width": 11, "height": 35}, {"width": 94, "height": 65}, {"width": 47, "height": 72}, {"width": 92, "height": 12}, {"width": 11, "height": 39}, {"width": 90, "height": 35}, {"width": 53, "height": 69}, {"width": 35, "height": 37}, {"width": 24, "height": 68}, {"width": 92, "height": 16}, {"width": 71, "height": 91}, {"width": 44, "height": 82}, {"width": 98, "height": 81}, {"width": 52, "height": 58}, {"width": 2, "height": 82}, {"width": 63, "height": 72}, {"width": 83, "height": 70}, {"width": 78, "height": 63}, {"width": 43, "height": 19}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box: DSInt(lb=1, ub=20) = 1
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Access the item and its assigned box index and position
        item_w: int = items[i].width
        item_h: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        box_idx: int = assignments[i]

        # Ensure the item fits within the boundaries of the box
        assert pos_x + item_w <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos_y + item_h <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_items_fit_in_assigned_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---

                assert (positions[i].x >= positions[j].x + items[j].width) or \

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Get the assigned box index for item i
        box_id: int = assignments[i]
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box boundaries
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                assert (
                    positions[i].x >= positions[j].x + items[j].width or
                    positions[j].x >= positions[i].x + items[i].width or
                    positions[i].y >= positions[j].y + items[j].height or
                    positions[j].y >= positions[i].y + items[i].height
                )

ensure_no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 52, "height": 98}, {"width": 11, "height": 35}, {"width": 94, "height": 65}, {"width": 47, "height": 72}, {"width": 92, "height": 12}, {"width": 11, "height": 39}, {"width": 90, "height": 35}, {"width": 53, "height": 69}, {"width": 35, "height": 37}, {"width": 24, "height": 68}, {"width": 92, "height": 16}, {"width": 71, "height": 91}, {"width": 44, "height": 82}, {"width": 98, "height": 81}, {"width": 52, "height": 58}, {"width": 2, "height": 82}, {"width": 63, "height": 72}, {"width": 83, "height": 70}, {"width": 78, "height": 63}, {"width": 43, "height": 19}]
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),

        # Ensure item fits within the box boundaries
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap

                    positions[j].x >= positions[i].x + items[i].width or

                )

ensure_no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

        assert positions[i].y >= 0

                         positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position), 
                         assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                # Overlap occurs if both horizontal and vertical projections overlap
                horizontal_overlap: bool = not (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                vertical_overlap: bool = not (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                assert not (horizontal_overlap and vertical_overlap)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index

def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_used: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_nr: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_nr > max_box_used:
            max_box_used = box_nr
    return max_box_used

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

) -> None:

        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        # Ensure item fits within box dimensions

        # Ensure item is placed within positive coordinates
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if box_assignments[i] == box_assignments[j]:
                # No overlap condition: rectangles do not overlap if one is to the left, right, above or below the other
                # This can be expressed as: (xi + wi <= xj) or (xj + wj <= xi) or (yi + hi <= yj) or (yj + hj <= yi)
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box (already ensured by domain of box_assignments)
    # Positions must be consistent with box boundaries
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item placement is within box boundaries
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        # These constraints are already covered by the field definitions of Position
        # but we reassert them for completeness based on problem requirements
        assert positions[i].x <= BOX_WIDTH - 1  # Since x is ge=0, le=100 and width >=1, x can be at most 99
        assert positions[i].y <= BOX_HEIGHT - 1  # Since y is ge=0, le=100 and height >=1, y can be at most 99

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
